content: The "FHA Downpayment Simplification Act of 2002" is an amendment to the National Housing Act, specifically Section 203 (12 U.S.C. 1709), aimed at simplifying downpayment requirements for housing loans. The "FHA Downpayment Simplification Act of 2002" amends the National Housing Act by removing certain sentences related to charges and fees, disclosure notices, and inserting new guidelines for mortgage insurance premiums. The FHA Downpayment Simplification Act of 2002 amends the National Housing Act by adjusting mortgage insurance premiums based on property appraised values.
